title: Heinz Kwiatkowski
text:
Heinrich "Heinz" Kwiatkowski (16 July 1926 – 23 May 2008) was a German <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a>. He was born in <a href="Gelsenkirchen">Gelsenkirchen</a>.
He was a member of the <a href="Germany%20national%20football%20team">West German</a> team that won the <a href="1954%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1954 FIFA World Cup</a>. He also participated in the <a href="1958%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1958 FIFA World Cup</a>. In total he earned four caps for West Germany. During his club career he played for <a href="FC%20Schalke%2004">FC Schalke 04</a>, <a href="Rot-Wei%C3%9F%20Essen">Rot-Weiß Essen</a> and <a href="Borussia%20Dortmund">Borussia Dortmund</a>. He won the <a href="German%20football%20championship">German football championship</a> with Dortmund in 1956 and 1957. He died in <a href="Dortmund">Dortmund</a>.
As a <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a>, Kwiatkowski's specialty was to fist the ball away, which earned him the nickname "Heini Fausten".
